LIBRARY
LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
Net Zero Emissions Legislation Around the World
September 2021
LL File No. 2021-020617
LRA-D-PUB-002566
The Law Library of Congress, Global Legal Research Directorate (202) 707-5080 (phone) • (866) 550-0442 (fax) • law@loc.gov • http://www.law.gov

This report is provided for reference purposes only. It does not constitute legal advice and does not represent the official opinion of the United States Government. The information provided reflects research undertaken as of the date of writing. It has not been updated.
Net Zero Emissions Legislation Around the World
Prepared by the Staff of the Global Legal Research Directorate

This table shows the 39 jurisdictions around the world that the Law Library of Congress has identified as having a net zero emissions or climate neutrality goal enshrined in legislation. This includes the European Union and its 27 member states, where a June 2021 regulation sets 2050 as the target date for climate neutrality. Eight EU member states have passed their own legislation in addition to the directly applicable regulation, including two that have set an earlier target date. To date, 11 countries outside the EU have passed legislation containing a net zero emissions goal, with two setting a target date earlier than 2050. At least three other countries have introduced or are expressly developing legislation that includes the goal.

JurisdictionEnacted LawsProposed Laws
European Union (EU)Regulation (EU) 2021/1119 (European Climate Law), art. 2, 2021 O.J. (L 243) 1, https://perma.cc/2GM3-9W99 (climate neutrality by 2050)
AustriaEU legislation applies
BelgiumEU legislation applies
BulgariaEU legislation applies
CanadaCanadian Net-Zero Emissions Accountability Act, S.C. 2021, c. 22, (Royal Assent June 29, 2021), https://perma.cc/MD3F-LL9E (net zero by 2050)
ChileClimate Change Framework Law, § IV.2.a, https://perma.cc/G2VN-MLNG (net zero by 2050) (submitted to National Congress Jan. 10, 2020, https://www.gob.cl/en/news/government-unveils-climate-change-bill-designed-decrease-negative-impacts-climate-change-chile/)
CroatiaEU legislation applies

FinlandEU legislation appliesSee also Klimatlag (FFS 609/2015), § 6, https://perma.cc/B7CL-J7B6
FranceCode de l'énergie, art. L100-4, https://perma.cc/MBZ8-28GM, as amended by Loi n° 2019-1147 du 8 novembre 2019 relative à l'énergie et au climat, art. 1, Nov. 8, 2019, https://perma.cc/VF4A-LGYZ (net zero by 2050)
GermanyBundes-Klimaschutzgesetz [KSG], Dec. 12, 2019, Bundesgesetzblatt [BGBl.] I at 2513, as amended, art. 3, para. 2, https://perma.cc/2RH2-V367 (climate neutrality by 2045)

HungaryLaw on Climate Policy: On the Declaration of a Climate Emergency, on Climate Protection, (T/7021), adopted on May 14, 2020, art. 3, § 4, https://perma.cc/683R-7U5M (climate neutrality by 2050)

JurisdictionEnacted LawsProposed Laws
IcelandClimate Act (Lög um loftslagsmål, 2012 nr. 70 29. Júní, https://perma.cc/D4YF-9TF6 (legally binding emissions reductions for 2030; specifies that the government can issue further legally binding targets. Current policy is carbon neutrality by 2040, https://perma.cc/3ZK3-Y6G8.) Not an EU member state but has a 2019 Climate Agreement with the European Union, https://perma.cc/RJW5-ADLZ
IrelandClimate Action and Low Carbon Development Act 2015, No. 46/2015, s 3(1), https://perma.cc/6Y4S-7KYN, as amended by the Climate Action and Low Carbon Development (Amendment) Act 2021, No. 32/2021, https://perma.cc/KTM6-FVNS (climate neutrality by 2050)
ItalyEU legislation applies
JapanAmendment (Act No. 54 of 2021) of Act on Promotion of Global Warming Countermeasures, Act No. 117 of 1998, art. 2-2, https://perma.cc/7NLD-WPC8 (in Japanese) (net zero by 2050)
LatviaEU legislation applies
LiechtensteinEmissionshandelsgesetz [EHG], Sept. 19, 2012, Landesgesetzblatt-Nummer [LGBl.-Nr.] 2012.346, as amended, art. 4, para. 4, https://perma.cc/LZL3-HW64 (climate neutrality by 2050) Note: The climate neutrality goal might get codified in the CO2 Act instead when an amended version of the CO2 Act is passed

NorwayLov om klimamål (klimaloven) (LOV-2017-06-16-60) § 4, https://perma.cc/47QH-6R3B (reduce emissions by 90-95% compared to 1990 by 2050)Not an EU member state but has a 2019 Climate Agreement with the European Union, https://perma.cc/RJW5-ADLZ

South KoreaFramework Act on Carbon Neutral and Green Growth to Respond to Climate Crisis, Act No. 18469, Sept. 24, 2021, art. 7(1), https://perma.cc/ZQ4A-9CP5 (in Korean) (carbon neutrality by 2050)
SpainLey 7/2021, de 20 de mayo, de cambio climático y transmisión energetica, art. 3-2, Boletin Oficial del Estado, May 21, 2021, https://perma.cc/53XX-LSPE (climate neutrality by 2050)
SwedenKlimatlag (SFS 2017:720), § 3, https://perma.cc/V5HA-A333 (unofficial English translation), https://perma.cc/R4C5-WJPW (original Swedish version) (does not set specific timelines for emissions reductions, but government must review and set targets every four years. Official policy as of March 2021 is net zero emissions by 2045 (85% reduction compared to 1990), https://perma.cc/NS4A-ZVGB)
TaiwanThe premier recently tasked the Environmental Protection Administration with amending the Greenhouse Gas Reduction and Management Act to incorporate the
The Law Library of Congress
Net Zero Emissions Legislation Around the World

JurisdictionEnacted LawsProposed Laws
goal of net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, and rename the act the Climate Change Response Act. (Taiwan Working Toward Net-Zero Emissions by 2050, Overseas Community Aff. Council, Republic of China (Taiwan) (OCAC) (Sept. 2, 2021), https://perma.cc/F8FW-YQUK) Individual members of the Legislative Yuan proposed their own bills for amending the act to include the 2050 net-zero emissions goal. (See e.g., Yuan Zong No. 1711, Member Proposal No. 25885 (Feb. 26, 2021), https://perma.cc/66FW-XLRU (in Chinese); Yuan Zong No. 1711, Member Proposal No. 26787 (May 27, 2021), https://perma.cc/U7RM-G2L9 (in Chinese))
UkraineLaw of Ukraine on the Principles of Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification of Greenhouse Gas Emissions, No. 377-IX, adopted Dec. 12, 2019, in force since Jan. 1, 2021, (BBP), 2020, No. 22, p. 150, pmbl., https://perma.cc/8GN8-KEY2 (harmonizes Ukrainian legislation with standards of EU law (an obligation for Ukraine under the EU-Ukraine Association Agreement) and implements the provisions of Directives No. 2003/87/EC and No. 2004/101/EC)
United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern IrelandClimate Change Act 2008, c. 27, s 1(1), https://perma.cc/2HJ4-KNRJ, as inserted by the Climate Change Act 2008 (2050 Target Amendment) Order 2019, SI 2019/1056, https://perma.cc/43EM-ADDK (net zero by 2050)
